messages.message: Getting this error on master while trying to run webapp locally — anyone else see this?
@will do i have to do something new from the nginx changes you pushed in?
I went to webserver/server-nginx and tried to run ‘build-docker run-docker’ but ‘run-docker’ wouldn’t successfully execute. there was no ‘run-docker-proxy’.
You have to be on a branch with the run-docker-proxy target for my changes to be there (or work)
But those are changes in server-nginx, webapp shouldn’t be any different
got it. i assume then that it shouldn’t be required for most ppl building on master?
do we have to run nginx locally to get instabase running locally?
If you don’t want to use the proxy script
resolved — i just needed to clear cookies. I got this error because a cookie problem was redirecting me to an HTTP:// version of the site.
once i manually entered HTTPS:// I saw the real error “SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG”
aaand nvm — once i cleared cookies it send me back to the login screen (fooling me into thinking it worked), but i am stuck at the same error once i logged in
resolved (actually): running webapp in docker worked.
Anything that binds the webapp to 5000 on your mac will work

I’m getting the same error now:
```During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

2020-01-24T23:32:47Z {'REMOTE_ADDR': '127.0.0.1', 'REMOTE_PORT': '59733', 'HTTP_HOST': 'localhost:5000', (hidden keys: 27)} failed with ConnectionError```
Yay it's not just me! Running webapp in docker "fixed" that problem for me @Heymian but let's see if you get the same one I did after
mm it actually went away for me after i cleaned and stopped using reload = true
